intro: Sebastiania corniculata var. obtusifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved sebastiania, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, oval-shaped leaves with a waxy coating. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage. The species is also valued for its ability to tolerate a range of soil conditions, making it adaptable to various garden environments.
